reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: We loved everything about this hotel from its amazing location to the beautiful rooms and helpful staff. Cannot recommend highly enough and we will be back again in the future. Check out the beautiful restaurant where you eat breakfast for ultimate charm
reviews.title: Amazing location with perfect staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on the most beautiful square in Europe, we were happy that we splurged on this hotel. Unlike Prague, staying directly on the Krakow square was very romantic, exciting, and a lucky choice on our part. The hotel accommodations were excellent. The room and bathroom were clean and well appointed. The room size was on the larger size for Europe. Our windows on the second floor opened directly onto the square and we found ourselves keeping them open whenever we were in the room in order to hear the sounds of the square and the live jazz music during the evening wafting up to our room. Wentzl is a RS recommended property. The staff was helpful and attentive to our needs, especially with our request to arrange for a private car and driver ($150 flat fee for the six hour excursion) to take us to Auschwitz (a well-advised choice instead of joining a tour or using public transportation). We chose not to purchase the hotel breakfast because there so many morning coffee and breakfast options within a block of the square, so we can not comment on it. We could not find fault with this hotel, and it possibly has the best location in Krakow.
reviews.title: Romantic hotel and ideal location on the Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have just arrived home after a 5 night stay at Hotel Wentzl in Krakow in late July 2013. We stayed in room 36 which is a twin room with excellent air-conditioning (great as it got very hot outside during our stay). The room was very comfortable and kept clean throughout our stay. WiFi is completely free. We asked for extra pillows on the first day and these were brought to the room very quickly. The room has a nice balcony with two chairs and, although our room did not offer a view of the main square unlike some of the other rooms (note the square facing rooms do not have a balcony, just a window), this did not bother us at all. Our room was very quiet both day and night. The hotel location is, in any case, perfect as you walk straight out onto the main square where there is a hive of activity going on from morning through to late night which you can watch sitting at one of the many cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: A perfect stay at Hotel Wentzl

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: All of the hotel staff were very courteous and friendly (standing up to greet you as you leave or enter the hotel !) and special thanks to Joanna for organising our private tours of Auschwitz-Birkenau and the Wieliczka salt mine.
reviews.title: The only place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very nice, offering a wide range of continental and cooked-to-order options. We did not have evening dinner and chose to visit a number of the highly rated Trip Advisor restaurants which were all within walking distance of the hotel (e.g. Restauracja Starka, Trzy Kroki w Szalenstwo are two excellent restaurants we tried out).
reviews.title: Wentzl is a Wonder
exquisite hotel, great location!
reviews.text: I selected this hotel based on the reviews of other travelers, and I was not disappointed. I wanted a hotel in a central location, so I was willing to pay a bit more. I asked for a room facing the square, with a bathtub (based on reviews I'd read that stated some bathrooms were smaller than others). When I walked into the room, I thought it was the most beautiful room I had ever stayed in (room 25). It was enormous and beautifully decorated. The view was fantastic. The staff is great. I love how they stand up to greet you when you walk down the stairs from your room or come in from outside. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I can't say one bad thing about it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Wentzl for 3 nights in early October, 2008. Fabulous rooms, staff and LOCATION. Loved seeing Krakow and coming home each night to the Wentzl made the trip perfect.
reviews.title: Fabulous Wentzl

likes.liked: — Location and friendly staff and free wifi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in an awesome location. We took a room with a view of the square and couldn't have asked for better. The view was extremely fascinating and an ideal viewpoint to watch and listen to the trumpeter in the tower. The decor and facilities are first class and the breakfast was excellent, including the hot choices. We ate in the restaurant the first night and were extremely pleased with the quality and the prices. Having just attended our first Polish wedding (amazing) and another to look forward to in October (our son's), the highlight of the stay had to be watching 2 different brides and grooms in the square at 6 am 2 mornings in succession, having their bridal photos taken. Would definitely go back to the Wentzl.
reviews.title: Brides & Grooms at 6 am

likes.liked: — The quality of the furnishings in the room
likes.disliked: — I didn't dislike anything about it at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Used the Wentzl recently for a business event when we ran out of space at Andel's Hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — Loved my room (41), great decor, big LCD, great view over square
likes.disliked: — Really can't think of anything negative.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are really well furnished and mostly individual in terms of design and layout. The price was very competitive given the time of year and the fact that this hotel is right on the main square.
reviews.title: Overall good
Lovely hotel, superb location
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel over New Years Eve for three nights in total. We booked with the hotel directly and found them to be helpful and efficient with their responses - the website is excellent and gives a good idea of what each room will look like so you can make an educated decision before you book, but the staff will also advise you on which rooms overlook the square if you ask (and after all, that's the beauty of staying here!!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: The hotel is fifteen minutes walk from the train station - there is a train from the airport to the station which takes around fifteen minutes - so it's an easy and do-able journey. You can't really get lost finding the hotel - just follow the signs to the main square and the Wentzl is on the far side of the square.
reviews.title: Stylish and luxurious Wentzl

likes.disliked: — DVD player in room, but no DVD's available!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little disappointed to find that when we arrived, the stage for New Years Eve had been put up right in front of the hotel - blocking the majority of our view from our room to the square (especially as our room was on the second floor and the stage was higher than this). I appreciate it was not the hotel's fault but found out on our return that the plans for the stage had been advertised widely some months before - it would have been nice of the hotel to drop us a note to let us know to save our initial disappointment. We did enquire as to rooms on a higher floor but were promptly advised none were available for the duration of our stay. Having paid for a a superior room so we could have a view of the square, we felt this a little unfair - but that said, it's a once a year event and anyone wanting to stay in the hotel at any other year shouldn't experience these kind of problems.
reviews.title: Small, charming, intimate and personal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself (room 23) was delighful with high ceilings and gorgeous modern bathroom. The lobby, staircase etc are very boutique in style and very stylish - for a five star hotel, we were a little suprised that there was no bar, or other communal areas, however - meaning there was little else apart from your room within the hotel to spend time within. There was a computer with free internet access which was handy. Breakfast in the hotel was very good with a wide variety of options including cooked breakfasts. We had very little interaction with the staff apart from check in and check out (they said a fleeting hello as we entered the building but that was pretty much it) but they seemed efficient and friendly. The cafe next door sold lovely cakes!!
reviews.title: Charming, stylish, quirky hotel in the heart of Krakow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The main sell for this hotel, however, is the location. Right on the main square, there are an abudance of restuarants and attractions on your doorstep. If you go in winter (like we did) where the weather can be minus 8 at times, it's nice to have your lovely warm hotel room to nip back to, to thaw out, before heading out again.
reviews.title: Brilliant find

likes.liked: — the location and views from window.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in Krakow at this hotel. The location is fantastic and the view from the room doesn't get much better. Staff is friendly and helpful with advice. Breakfast was only slightly above average, with limited choice in terms of bread (unless you are a big fan of white bread). One improvement opportunity: we arrived by our own car and had not been informed ahead of our arrival that the hotel has it's own parking place in a nearby side street off the market square. We ended up getting almost lost in the oneway streets leading to the square and had to leave the car several hundred meters away.
reviews.title: The best location in Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for four nights in March and thought the level of service provided and the standard of the accommodation were excellent. The hotel is an period town house so has a boutique feel to it. The room was dramatically decorated in deep reds, purples and black and it was spacious,stylish and well appointed. But what really makes this hotel special is the location on the main square of Krakow, it is so very convenient for all Krakow's attractions, restaurants and nightlife. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: plush and superbly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located right on the old town market square the Wentzl is a part of Krakow history. Home to a wealthy merchant it has character and charm. Staff are attentive and very helpful. Are room was large enough for two with our suitcases so that we did not have to concern ourselves with tripping over the bags when walking around the room. The bath/shower is a good size.
reviews.title: Great Location and Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being centrally located makes it very easy to walk to all the areas of the old town.
reviews.title: Old World Elegance on the Old Town Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfasts are served in their main restaurant which has some of the most interesting décor one might find in hotels. The decoration resembles an elegant drawing room with chandeliers, drapery and mirrors that are done very well. Very unique.
reviews.title: view from balcony: spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel Wentzl is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, no question, and I say this as a frequent traveller. Everything about our stay was fantastic, from the perfect location on the square to the lovely, sizeable room to the great breakfast! I loved it and can't wait to return!
reviews.title: A Fantastic Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: A very nice hotel with some beautiful comfortable rooms with all the amenities. The location could not get better as it is over looking the main square. They organized all the trips before hand to ensure we had timings on the days we needed to see Auschwitz & the salt mines. Great and genuinely friendly staff (Joanne at the reception) !!! Will definitely go back and spend more days in Krakow !!
reviews.title: Amazing place in the heart of Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a tour of the Baltic States visiting Tallinn, Riga and Vilnius and ending up in Krakow in Poland, I have discovered that the most important criterion for a successful short stay in new city for me is to be right in the centre where all the life is. The Hotel Wentzl is the only Hotel in the Medieval square of Rynek Glowny in Krakow and is perfectly located to enjoy every single moment of a visit to this exquisite jewel of a city. All the rooms face over the Square, which is fascinating at all times of the day and night, with horse-drawn carriages, live music and entertainments, and magnificent Medieval buildings to admire, as well as hundreds of pavement cafes to sit at to watch the world go by. The Wentzl is a small boutique hotel with very comfortable rooms and there is an excellent restaurant run as a separate concern inside the hotel. The hotel staff were charming and helpful.
reviews.title: the secret of visiting new cities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: An excellent hotel right on the famous square.Rooms were very spacious and furnisheds to very high quality. Hotel mstaff were very helpful and booked our trip to Auswich. Krakow os an amazing place, we were not here long enough as we were attending a Polish Wedding 2.5 hours drive from Krakow, we will return for a longer stay - loads of restaurants on and off the square all good value.
reviews.title: Wow Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is first class. The staff, who can't do enough for you. To the rooms and restaurant. Not to mention the amazing location in the square.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Wentzl and were sorry to leave. The room was spacious and had the most perfect view of Market Square. We were so perfectly located for the major sights and truly just to enjoy the location. When we weren't out and about I sat staring out the open window mesmerized by the view. The staff were all extremely helpful with any request. They also helped me with parking my car as we both weren't up for finding a spot after a long drive. They gave us great recommendations for food in the area too. The hotel had everything you would need, including slippers and robes. It was also nicely decorated. We ate breakfast one morning. It is not included and is a bit more expensive than I am used to (especially given the overall lower cost of food in Poland compared to other European countries) but it was good. There were lots of options and it is worth doing once to be in the unique dining room. If you are in Krakow and want to be in the heart of it all, this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: The hotel was perfectly located in the main square, perfect for restaurants, shopping and tours.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, professional and the rooms were large and comfortable.
reviews.title: An Amazing Stay in Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Highly recommend, great value for money.
reviews.title: Best Hotel, Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of all the hotels in Krakow I've always found Hotel Wentzl to be the absolute best. The rooms are very well apportioned and beautiful. Perfect location. A/C, WiFi, Great staff. Top notch! Well worth it
reviews.title: Fantastic Place, Careless with my Credit Card

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the Wentzl in Room 21, with a wonderful view of the square. All the positives in prior oreviews are not overstatements. The location could not have been better. The double windows kept out essentially all noise, including everything but the deepest bass of the big tango party going on in the square. And it didn't go on very late.
reviews.title: Outstanding in all respects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common areas and the room are all tastefully decorated and yet comfortable and welcoming. My only issue with the room is that the bed is on a raised platform that extends about a foot beyond the bed in all directions, and it took me two days to not either trip on it or fall off the ledge. More a challenge than a complaint r problem. And the artwork in the room more than made up for it. In fact, maybe I tripped because I was looking at the paintings intead of where I was going!
reviews.title: Old Town location - Wentzl Hotel

likes.liked: — Location, rooms, B&B feel, included Breakfast
likes.disliked: — Parking, access to hotel with an automobile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff could not have been more friendly or accommodating. All of our questions were answered patiently and helpfully. A cheerful greeting awaited each of our returns.
reviews.title: Wentzl is all they say and more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel enthusiastically and without hesitation. Everything about it was perfect.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - couldn't fault it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Btw, I vote for Auschwitz without a guide. Although there may be less information, it is a place that speaks for itself and individually to each visitor, and I think the constant talk of a guide, no matter how well-intended, would diminish the powerful experience. Read about it ahead of time, and ponder the implications in quiet.
reviews.title: A glorious hotel

likes.disliked: — Had to fly BMI Baby to get there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Wentzl in November last year. Each of the 30 odd rooms are individually decorated, and fantastically decorated at that! If you go onto their website you will get a picture of every room in the hotel - this was a first for me, and I work in travel. You can request the room you want, everything from high ceiling baroque to high tech - they are fantastically decorated. The hotel is right on the main square so position wise it doesn't get any better. The staff were so pleasant and helpful and will assist with all tours - just remember that as it is outside agencies they confirm you will have to pay in cash separately for any excursions. We had an evening meal in the Wenzl restaurant (menus and prices are available on their website) and the food was fantastic! The setting was 'olde worlde', with views over the old town square (and it happened to be snowing!), the food was exquisite (definately in favour of the meat lover) and the service wonderful. Overall, I would definately pay a bit more for this hotel - position, staff, dcor, cleanliness - this hotel has it all!!
reviews.title: Fantastic position, beautiful rooms, wonderful staff! It's pretty damn good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Funky room, yet extremely comfortable. Great location right on the main square. Go for a loft room if you smoke, as they have small balconies. Great view too from the top floor rooms. Good breakfast selection. This hotel deserves all the praise it gets, from the staff, to the quality of the rooms. We'd have no hesitation in booking this hotel again, without even looking at anything else.
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: boyfriend brought me here as a birthday treat - and what a treat. The hotel location is fabulous - looking on to the city square. Lots of nice bars and restaurants around.
reviews.title: Very special experience
Charming Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel itself was just simply wonderful. Lovely welcome, and the room was sumptuous. (Room 25). I stay in a lot of business hotels because of work, and the Wentzl rooms have real character. I particularly loved the bathroom with its wall of tealights - very romantic. The room also had a well stocked mini bar which was very reasonably priced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: food was superb. Breakfast was great - the Viennese eggs (chopped soft boiled eggs in butter) were lovely - and there was a wide selection of cheeses, cold meats, and an array of breads. We had dinner in the restaurant one night and it was excellent. The dining room is very formal, as is the service and good for a special occasion.
reviews.title: Cannot imagine a better place to stay in Krakov
